item.description: The Coolidge Corner Theatre's Science on Screen series presents IT CAME FROM BENEATH THE SEA, director Robert Gordon's 1955 sci-fi adventure about a gigantic, irradiated octopus (created by effects maestor Ray Harryhausen) that unleashes a tidal wave of terror on San Francisco. Before the film, University of Chicago biologist Michael LaBarbera, speaks about the biology of B-movie monsters. More at www.coolidge.org/science.
item.name: Screening: It Came from Beneath the Sea
